snippet: In the latest challenge to same-sex marriage restrictions, a federal judge in Nashville said Friday that Tennessee must recognize the status of three couples who were married in other states.
abstract: Federal Judge Aleta A Trauger says Tennessee must recognize the status of three same-sex couples who were married in other states; ruling is preliminary and applies only to these couples, pending a broader decision on whether Tennessee must recognize same-sex marriages performed elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: In the latest challenge to same-sex marriage restrictions, a federal judge in Nashville said Friday that Tennessee must recognize the status of three couples who were married in other states.

headline.main: Tennessee: Ruling Favors 3 Gay Couples Seeking Recognition of Marriages
headline.print_headline: Tennessee: Ruling Favors 3 Gay Couples Seeking Recognition of Marriages

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
